docs.title: About this documentation
docs.description: Welcome to the Data Provider documentation!

docs.title: How to create origin addons
docs.description: Data Provider is agnostic about data origins, so it can be used to read data from a REST API, from localStorage, or from any other origin. Custom addons are distributed for each different type of origin, and you can even create your owns.

docs.title: Addons
docs.description: Addons provide a way to support and extend the behavior of Data Provider. Edit this page in Github and open a PR to submit your own plugin.

docs.title: Events
docs.description: Data Provider includes an event emitter that allows to be continually informed about what is happening and react in consequence.

docs.title: Provider
docs.description: A Provider defines an specific resource of a data origin.

docs.title: providers
docs.description: Purpose

docs.title: Providers and selectors methods
docs.description: This chapter describes all methods common to providers and selectors. If you haven't done it already, we recommend you to first read the Selector API and Provider API to deeply learn what they are, and how to create them.

docs.title: Api Reference
docs.description: This section documents the complete Data Provider API. Keep in mind that Data Provider is not concerned about the views or about specific data origins. You'll also want to use UI bindings like @data-provider/react and origins like @data-provider/axios.

docs.title: Selector
docs.description: A Selector combines origins or other selectors (what we call "dependencies"), and returns a new result.

docs.title: storeManager
docs.description: Purpose

docs.title: Actions
docs.description: Defining actions for providers

docs.title: Configuration
docs.description: Configuring providers

docs.title: Running the example
docs.description: Now that we have all the code of our tiny todo app, we are going to create the "server" to which the application will request the todos.

docs.title: Intro
docs.description: In this guide we'll walk through the process of creating a simple Todo app connected to a REST Api.

docs.title: Providers
docs.description: Defining providers

docs.title: Queries
docs.description: Querying providers and selectors

docs.title: Selectors
docs.description: Defining selectors

docs.title: Usage with React
docs.description: From the very beginning, we need to stress that Data Provider has no relation to React. You can use Data Provider with React, Angular, Vue, jQuery, or vanilla JavaScript.

docs.title: Get started
docs.description: Getting started with Data Provider

docs.title: Installation
docs.description: NPM Installation

docs.title: Motivation
docs.description: Why you should not use your app state as a data cache

docs.title: Recipes
docs.description: These are some use cases and code snippets to get you started with Data Provider in a real app. They assume assume you understand the topics in basic tutorial and you have read the API section.

docs.title: Querying selectors
docs.description: Next examples assume assume you understand the topics in basic tutorial and you have read the API section. They also assume that you are familiarized with the syntax used when querying a provider created with the addon @data-provider/axios.
